===Microsoft Windows===
===Microsoft Windows===
{{Main|Microsoft Windows}}
{{Main|Microsoft Windows}}

+
[[File:Windows To Go USB Drive.png|thumb|Bootable [[Windows To Go]] USB flash drive|link=Windows To Go]]
Microsoft Windows is a family of [[proprietary software|proprietary]] operating systems designed by [[Microsoft Corporation]] and primarily targeted to Intel architecture based computers, with an estimated 88.9 percent total usage share on Web connected computers.<ref>{{cite news|title=Global Web Stats|url=http://marketshare.hitslink.com/operating-system-market-share.aspx?qprid=8|date=May 2011 |publisher=Net Market Share, Net Applications |accessdate=2011-5-7}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Global Web Stats|url=http://www.w3counter.com/globalstats.php|date=September 2009|publisher=W3Counter, Awio Web Services|accessdate=2009-10-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Operating System Market Share |url=http://marketshare.hitslink.com/operating-system-market-share.aspx?qprid=8 |publisher=Net Applications |date=October 2009 |accessdate=November 5, 2009}}</ref><ref name="StatCounter"/> Currently, the most widely used version of the Windows family is [[Windows XP]],<ref>{{cite web |title=66% of all Windows users still use Windows XP |url=http://www.conceivablytech.com/3227/business/66-of-all-windows-users-still-use-windows-xp/|accessdate=November 18, 2010}}</ref> released on October 25, 2001. The newest version is [[Windows 7]] for workstations and [[Windows Server 2008 R2]] for servers.
Microsoft Windows is a family of [[proprietary software|proprietary]] operating systems designed by [[Microsoft Corporation]] and primarily targeted to Intel architecture based computers, with an estimated 88.9 percent total usage share on Web connected computers.<ref>{{cite news|title=Global Web Stats|url=http://marketshare.hitslink.com/operating-system-market-share.aspx?qprid=8|date=May 2011 |publisher=Net Market Share, Net Applications |accessdate=2011-5-7}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Global Web Stats|url=http://www.w3counter.com/globalstats.php|date=September 2009|publisher=W3Counter, Awio Web Services|accessdate=2009-10-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |title=Operating System Market Share |url=http://marketshare.hitslink.com/operating-system-market-share.aspx?qprid=8 |publisher=Net Applications |date=October 2009 |accessdate=November 5, 2009}}</ref><ref name="StatCounter"/> Currently, the most widely used version of the Windows family is [[Windows XP]],<ref>{{cite web |title=66% of all Windows users still use Windows XP |url=http://www.conceivablytech.com/3227/business/66-of-all-windows-users-still-use-windows-xp/|accessdate=November 18, 2010}}</ref> released on October 25, 2001. The newest version is [[Windows 7]] for workstations and [[Windows Server 2008 R2]] for servers.
